member.name: T:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.Constants.Localization.DefaultMessages
member.summary:
Provides default English messages for all localization keys. These are used as fallback when database translations are not available, ensuring the UI displays readable text instead of message keys.
Fallback Priority: 1. Site-specific translation (DB) 2. Company-specific translation (DB) 3. System translation (DB) 4. English translation (DB) 5. Default message from this class (Code) 6. Message key in brackets [key] (Last resort)
This class is compatible with both .NET Framework and .NET Core/.NET 8+

member.name: F:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.Constants.Localization.DefaultMessages.Messages
member.summary: Read-only dictionary of default English messages indexed by message key.

member.name: M:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.Constants.Localization.DefaultMessages.GetDefault(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the default English message for a given message key. Returns null if no default message exists for the key.
member.param: The message key to look up
member.returns: The default English message, or null if not found

member.name: M:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.Constants.Localization.DefaultMessages.GetDefaultFormatted(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Gets the default English message for a given message key with formatting. Returns the formatted default message, or null if no default exists.
member.param: The message key to look up
member.returns: The formatted default English message, or null if not found

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.Configuration.WorkflowApprovalLevel_DTO.Name
member.summary: Human-readable name of this approval level Example: "Manager Approval", "Director Approval", "CEO Approval"

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.Configuration.WorkflowApprovalLevel_DTO.Description
member.summary: Description of approval responsibilities

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.Configuration.WorkflowApprovalLevel_DTO.RequiredRoles
member.summary: Roles that can approve at this level Example: ["Manager", "Director"] means anyone with Manager or Director role

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.Configuration.WorkflowApprovalLevel_DTO.MinimumAmount
member.summary: Minimum amount/count that triggers this approval level Used for value-based approvals (Orders > $10K need Director approval)

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.Configuration.WorkflowApprovalLevel_DTO.MaximumAmount
member.summary: Maximum amount/count for this approval level Orders <= $10K use Manager approval, Orders <= $50K use Director approval

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.Configuration.WorkflowApprovalLevel_DTO.AllowDelegation
member.summary: Whether approvals at this level can be delegated Example: Manager on vacation can delegate to another Manager

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.Configuration.WorkflowApprovalLevel_DTO.DelegationMaxDays
member.summary: Maximum number of days an approval at this level can be delegated

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.Configuration.WorkflowApprovalLevel_DTO.IsRequired
member.summary: Whether this approval level is required for all items Or can be skipped based on conditions

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.Configuration.WorkflowApprovalLevel_DTO.ApprovalTimeoutHours
member.summary: Time limit (in hours) for approval at this level before escalation Example: 24 means escalate if not approved within 24 hours

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.Configuration.WorkflowApprovalLevel_DTO.DisplayOrder
member.summary: Order of execution for this approval level Lower numbers are evaluated/executed first

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.Configuration.WorkflowApprovalLevel_DTO.ConditionalExpression
member.summary: Conditional expression that determines if this level applies Example: "TotalAmount > 10000 AND TotalAmount <= 50000"

member.name: T:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.Configuration.WorkflowNotificationRule_DTO
member.summary: Response DTO for WorkflowNotificationRule Defines when and to whom notifications are sent during workflow execution Examples: Send email when entering PENDING_APPROVAL state, SMS on rejection

member.summary: Unique identifier for this notification rule

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.Configuration.WorkflowNotificationRule_DTO.WorkflowDefinitionId
member.summary: Reference to the parent WorkflowDefinition

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.Configuration.WorkflowNotificationRule_DTO.TriggerType
member.summary: Type of trigger that causes this notification Valid values: EnterState, ExitState, Transition, SLAWarning, SLAViolation, Approval, Rejection

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.Configuration.WorkflowNotificationRule_DTO.TriggerValue
member.summary: Specific value for the trigger For EnterState: state code (e.g., "PENDING_APPROVAL") For Transition: transition action (e.g., "Approve", "Reject") For SLAWarning: state code

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.Configuration.WorkflowNotificationRule_DTO.NotificationType
member.summary: Type of notification to send Valid values: Email, SMS, Push, InApp, Webhook

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.Configuration.WorkflowNotificationRule_DTO.RecipientStrategy
member.summary: Strategy for determining who receives the notification Valid values: Requester, Requester_Manager, ApprovalLevel, Role, User, Email, Custom Examples: - "Requester" = person who initiated the workflow - "Requester_Manager" = requester's direct manager - "ApprovalLevel:Level1" = users in approval level 1 - "Role:Manager" = all users with Manager role

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.Configuration.WorkflowNotificationRule_DTO.TemplateId
member.summary: Template ID for the notification message Used to look up email/SMS template from template service Example: "purchase-order-approval-request", "workflow-submitted-notification"

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.Configuration.WorkflowNotificationRule_DTO.DelayMinutes
member.summary: Delay before sending notification (in minutes) Useful for "Send reminder after 1 hour if not approved" workflows Null = send immediately

member.summary: Whether this notification is enabled

member.summary: Display order for this notification Multiple notifications can be triggered by same event

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.Configuration.WorkflowNotificationRule_DTO.Description
member.summary: Description of what this notification does

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.Configuration.WorkflowResolveRequest_DTO.EntityType
member.summary: Type of entity to resolve workflow for Example: "PurchaseOrder", "StockIssueRequest", "SalesOrder", "PurchaseDeliveryNote"

member.summary: The entity object or its properties for applicability rule evaluation Can be the full entity serialized as JSON Used to evaluate applicability rules like ProductCategory, SupplierType, OrderValue

member.summary: Additional context for workflow resolution Can include user info, site, tenant, etc.

member.summary: Whether to return multiple matching workflows (all that apply) Default is false = return only the best matching one

member.summary: Whether to include inactive workflows in resolution Default is false = only consider active workflows

member.summary: The primary/best matching workflow This is the highest priority workflow that matched all applicability rules

member.summary: All matching workflows (if ReturnAllMatches was true in request) Sorted by priority (highest first)

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.Configuration.WorkflowResolveResponse_DTO.MatchedRules

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.Configuration.WorkflowResolveResponse_DTO.UnmatchedRules

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.Configuration.WorkflowResolveResponse_DTO.WorkflowFound
member.summary: Whether a workflow was found false = no matching workflow, entity cannot proceed

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.Configuration.WorkflowResolveResponse_DTO.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Error message if workflow resolution failed

member.summary: How resolution was performed (for debugging) Example: "Matched 2 applicable workflows, selected highest priority", "Default workflow used"

member.name: T:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.TransactionCreation.CreateFromMultipleSourcesRequest
member.summary: Request DTO for creating a transaction from multiple source transactions (consolidation) Extends CreateFromSourceRequest with multi-source capabilities

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.TransactionCreation.CreateFromMultipleSourcesRequest.SourceIds
member.summary: Source transaction IDs to consolidate into a single target transaction. Required. All sources must be compatible (e.g., same customer, same warehouse). Example: Consolidate multiple sales orders from the same customer into one picking note.

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.TransactionCreation.CreateFromMultipleSourcesRequest.ConsolidateBy
member.summary: Consolidation grouping option. If None or null, all sources are consolidated into a single transaction. If specified, sources are grouped by the option (e.g., by Customer, Warehouse, DeliveryDate) and one transaction is created per group.

member.name: T:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.TransactionCreation.CreateFromSourceRequest
member.summary: Request DTO for creating a transaction from a source transaction Supports partial creation, quantity overrides, and splitting

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.TransactionCreation.CreateFromSourceRequest.SelectedLineIds
member.summary: Specific line IDs to include in the created transaction. If null or empty, all eligible lines from the source will be included. Use this for selective line creation (e.g., pick only certain items from an order).

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.TransactionCreation.CreateFromSourceRequest.LineQuantities
member.summary: Override quantities per line ID (key = line ID, value = quantity to use). If not specified for a line, the full remaining/available quantity is used. Useful for partial fulfillment (e.g., issue 50 of 100 requested units).

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.TransactionCreation.CreateFromSourceRequest.CopyComments
member.summary: Whether to copy comments from the source transaction to the created transaction. Default is true.

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.TransactionCreation.CreateFromSourceRequest.SplitBy
member.summary: Split option for creating multiple transactions from one source. For example, split an order into multiple picking notes by warehouse. If None or null, creates a single transaction.

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.TransactionCreation.CreateFromSourceRequest.Overrides
member.summary: Property overrides to apply to the created transaction header. Key is property name (e.g., "RequiredDate", "Priority", "Comments"). Value is the value to set (will be cast to appropriate type). Use sparingly - most properties should be mapped automatically.

member.name: T:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.TransactionCreation.TransactionCreationResult
member.summary: Result DTO for transaction creation operations Contains details about created transactions, warnings, and errors

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.TransactionCreation.TransactionCreationResult.Success
member.summary: Indicates whether the operation was successful True if at least one transaction was created successfully

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.TransactionCreation.TransactionCreationResult.Message
member.summary: Summary message describing the result Example: "Created 3 picking notes from 2 sales orders"

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.TransactionCreation.TransactionCreationResult.CreatedTransactions
member.summary: List of successfully created transactions Empty if no transactions were created

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.TransactionCreation.TransactionCreationResult.Warnings
member.summary: Warning messages that occurred during creation Non-blocking issues (e.g., "Line 5 skipped - already fully picked")

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.TransactionCreation.TransactionCreationResult.Errors
member.summary: Error messages that prevented creation Blocking issues (e.g., "Source transaction not found")

member.name: T:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.TransactionCreation.CreatedTransactionInfo
member.summary: Information about a successfully created transaction Used in TransactionCreationResult to return details about created entities

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.TransactionCreation.CreatedTransactionInfo.EntityType
member.summary: Type of entity that was created (e.g., SalesPickingNote, StockIssue)

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.TransactionCreation.CreatedTransactionInfo.EntityId
member.summary: Primary key ID of the created transaction

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.TransactionCreation.CreatedTransactionInfo.TransactionNumber
member.summary: Transaction number (e.g., "PKN-2024-00123", "ISU-2024-00456")

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.TransactionCreation.CreatedTransactionInfo.StatusCode
member.summary: Workflow status code of the created transaction (e.g., "DRAFT", "APPROVED")

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.TransactionCreation.CreatedTransactionInfo.LineCount
member.summary: Number of lines in the created transaction

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.TransactionCreation.CreatedTransactionInfo.SourceEntityIds
member.summary: Source entity IDs that this transaction was created from Useful for traceability and audit trail

member.name: P:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.Transactions.Purchasing.PurchaseDeliveryNote_Response_DTO.DeliveryAddressId

member.name: T:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.DTOs.Transactions.Stock.StockPutAway_Response_DTO
member.summary: Response DTO for StockPutAway entity. Represents a put-away task to move received goods from receiving location to final storage bins. Triggered after Purchase Delivery Note (PDN) or other receipt transactions. Supports directed (system-suggested), random (manual), and fixed location put-away strategies.

member.name: T:MES.Office.WebAPI.Contracts.Interfaces.v1.IApiClient`2
member.summary: Base interface for all API client operations Defines the standard contract for 3rd party API consumption
member.typeparam: The edit DTO type for create/update operations
member.remarks:
This interface provides a stable contract for external applications. All API operations return Result<T> for consistent error handling.
VERSIONING: - This is version 1 (v1) of the API contract - Breaking changes should result in a new version (v2, v3, etc.) - This ensures backward compatibility for 3rd party integrations
USAGE: Implement this interface for each entity type to provide standard CRUD operations. External applications can depend on this contract without coupling to internal implementation.
